body: Initial feeling is we're waiting for a folder that's scanning, not sure why that takes so long though.

rename.from: Web GUI deadlock - pause and resume not registered, restart and shutdown panic

body: It's trying to get a db snapshot and there's some leveldb routines mentioning compaction - if that is an actual ongoing compaction I suspect that's the reason for the wait and no deadlock.

The folder is shared between A and B. A is "Send & Receive", while B is "Receive Only". No new files are being added to the folder on both sides, so any possible scanning takes very little time. A is constantly sending its files to B at slow speed. The deadlock happens only on B.

Also, just for completeness, we are talking about the folder discussed previously in https://forum.syncthing.net/t/downloading-large-files-in-one-folder-prevents-pushing-changes-to-other-folders/14513. Syncthing is limited to 25 KB/s upload on A with Windows QoS policies, but this does not prevent it from properly pausing and resuming all the other folders shared between A and B.

It seems that the puller routine exits and the rest of stuff is hanging because of that:
```
Line 575: github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/model.(*sendReceiveFolder).pullerIteration.func4(0xc0009b0f00, 0xc000a18280, 0xc012a40d20, 0xc012a40d80, 0xc012a40c00, 0x110c580, 0xc00b2eac10)
Line 1193: github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/model.(*sendReceiveFolder).pullerIteration.func2(0xc0009b0f00, 0xc012a40cc0, 0xc012a40c60, 0xc012a40d20, 0x110c580, 0xc00b2eac00)
Line 1201: github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/model.(*sendReceiveFolder).pullerIteration.func2(0xc0009b0f00, 0xc012a40cc0, 0xc012a40c60, 0xc012a40d20, 0x110c580, 0xc00b2eac00)
Line 1209: github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/model.(*sendReceiveFolder).pullerIteration.func1(0xc0009b0f00, 0xc012a40d80, 0x110c580, 0xc00b2eac20)
```

Note there is no `pullerIteration.func3`

I suspect it exits because the context gets closed:
```
if err := requestLimiter.takeWithContext(f.ctx, bytes); err != nil {
	break
}
```

and the rest of the routines do not check the context, and just hang on `pullChan <- foo`
The idea is that even failed stuff should flow through the finisher, to unregister progress listeners. It's not ok just to terminate the pull pipeline half way through.
Thanks for detecting. That's a regression from #6343. Unless you want to I'll fix this tonight.
I suspect something similar might be happening with protocol package, given the Request() hanging for 42mins in the first panic log provided in the forum thread.

Thank you for such a quick investigation. Today, while trying to set a completely new device up, I started to get even more lockups of the UI, which became completely unusable, so I have downgraded to 1.4.0 on this machine for now. Strangely enough, 1.4.2 seems to be working fine on the other devices.

During the lockups, Syncthing did not crash, so there are no panic logs, but this is what I got in the regular log file:

```
[D4DZU] 23:04:26 INFO: Adding folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx)
[D4DZU] 23:04:26 INFO: No stored folder metadata for "xxxxx-xxxxx"; recalculating
[D4DZU] 23:04:26 INFO: Ready to synchronize "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx) (sendreceive)
[D4DZU] 23:04:26 INFO: Completed initial scan of sendreceive folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx)
[D4DZU] 23:05:22 INFO: Failed to exchange Hello messages with TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at [::]:22000-217.99.29.67:22000/quic-server/TLS1.3-TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256: EOF
[D4DZU] 23:06:35 INFO: Failed to exchange Hello messages with TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at [::]:22000-217.99.29.67:22000/quic-server/TLS1.3-TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256: EOF
[D4DZU] 23:08:14 INFO: Failed to exchange Hello messages with TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at [::]:22000-217.99.29.67:22000/quic-server/TLS1.3-TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256: EOF
[D4DZU] 23:08:26 INFO: Failed to exchange Hello messages with TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at [::]:22000-217.99.29.67:22000/quic-server/TLS1.3-TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256: EOF
[D4DZU] 23:09:21 INFO: Puller (folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx), item "xxx"): pull: generic error
[D4DZU] 23:09:40 INFO: Failed to exchange Hello messages with TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at [::]:22000-217.99.29.67:22000/quic-server/TLS1.3-TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256: EOF
```

The UI was unresponsive during that time. Shutdown and restart also did not do anything, and I had to completely kill `syncthing.exe` to end the process. Starting it again did not help though, as the UI would lock up almost immediately again.

All the lockups seem to be gone for good after downgrading to 1.4.0.
I am not sure it's related, but let's wait for this to be fixed, you can try the dev build to see if it fixes it or not.

issue.title: lib/model: Don't exit pullerRoutine on cancelled ctx (fixes #6559)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.6.0
milestone.description:
This release performs a database schema migration, and adds the `BlockPullOrder`, `DisableFsync` and `MaxConcurrentWrites` folder options to the configuration schema.

The `LocalChangeDetected` event no longer has the `action` set to `added` for new files, instead showing `modified` for all local file changes.

issue.body: The actual fix is super small, just what @AudriusButkevicius wrote in #6559. Writing the test caused most of the diff :)

body:
Please try the build from https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/pull/6562

See if you can still reproduce the issue.

Hmm, I have cherry-picked the commit straight on top of v1.4.2, which I hope is okay, and now I seem to be able to pause and resume the folder with almost immediate effect.

However, the GUI keeps locking up every now and then, randomly, and then suddenly comes back to life after 5-10 minutes. When locked up, all folders are "Unknown", and commands like "Shutdown" and "Restart" do not work.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/79956165-bee9d380-84ba-11ea-8847-0ce1d3361b8c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/79956194-c90bd200-84ba-11ea-81bf-274bcbe52633.png)

Logfile from D4DZU:
```
[D4DZU] 16:43:26 INFO: "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx): Failed to sync 13 items
[D4DZU] 16:43:26 INFO: Folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx) isn't making sync progress - retrying in 2m41.3363883s.
[D4DZU] 16:43:43 INFO: Established secure connection to TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at [::]:22000-217.99.29.67:22000/quic-client/TLS1.3-TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
[D4DZU] 16:43:43 INFO: Device TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX client is "syncthing v1.4.2+2-g3ab5a9ec-dirty-v1.4.2-tomasz86" named "XXX" at [::]:22000-217.99.29.67:22000/quic-client/TLS1.3-TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
[D4DZU] 16:43:43 INFO: Device TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx) has mismatching index ID for us (0x052ED47646115491 != 0xBEBB031BC8D4679D)
[D4DZU] 16:43:43 INFO: Device TLFGVKC--XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx) has a new index ID (0x040EC1D08AD43DD5)
[D4DZU] 16:43:57 INFO: Completed initial scan of receiveonly folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx)
[D4DZU] 16:44:27 INFO: Puller (folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx), item "xxx"): pull: no such file
[D4DZU] 16:44:27 INFO: Puller (folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx), item "xxx"): pull: generic error
[D4DZU] 16:44:27 INFO: Puller (folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx), item "xxx"): pull: generic error
[D4DZU] 16:44:27 INFO: Puller (folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx), item "xxx"): pull: generic error
[D4DZU] 16:44:33 INFO: Puller (folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx), item "xxx"): pull: generic error
[D4DZU] 16:44:49 INFO: quic://0.0.0.0:22000 resolved external address quic://125.190.151.7:2498 (via stun.syncthing.net:3478)
[D4DZU] 16:49:59 INFO: quic://0.0.0.0:22000 resolved external address quic://125.190.151.7:2486 (via stun.syncthing.net:3478)
```

Logfile from TLFGV:
```
[TLFGV] 09:43:28 INFO: "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx): Failed to sync 9 items
[TLFGV] 09:43:28 INFO: Folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx) isn't making sync progress - retrying in 1h4m53.9626529s.
[TLFGV] 09:43:45 INFO: Established secure connection to D4DZUGP-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at [::]:22000-125.190.151.7:2486/quic-server/TLS1.3-TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
[TLFGV] 09:43:45 INFO: Device D4DZUGP-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX client is "syncthing v1.4.2+2-g3ab5a9ec-dirty-v1.4.2-tomasz86" named "XXX" at [::]:22000-125.190.151.7:2486/quic-server/TLS1.3-TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
[TLFGV] 09:43:45 INFO: Device D4DZUGP-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX folder "XXX" (xxxxx-xxxxx) has a new index ID (0xBEBB031BC8D4679D)
[TLFGV] 09:48:04 INFO: Established secure connection to 7LDIBZ4-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at 20.0.0.2:14508-160.16.88.249:22067/relay-client/TLS1.3-TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
[TLFGV] 09:48:04 INFO: Device 7LDIBZ4-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX client is "syncthing v1.4.2+2-g3ab5a9ec-dirty-v1.4.2-tomasz86" named "XXX" at 20.0.0.2:14508-160.16.88.249:22067/relay-client/TLS1.3-TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
[TLFGV] 09:48:05 INFO: Connection to 7LDIBZ4-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX at 20.0.0.2:14508-160.16.88.249:22067/relay-client/TLS1.3-TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 closed: reading length: EOF
```

The GUI was unresponsive for about 5 minutes, i.e. from 16:44 to 16:49 on D4DZU, and from 09:43 to 09:48 on TLFGV. This all happened at the same time, just the time zones are different.

I am not sure whether this is the same problem or a completely different one though. I had a similar lockup yesterday when D4DZU was on 1.4.0 and TLFGV was on 1.4.2. I do not recall having any of these lockups in the past though, i.e. before 1.4.1 or 1.4.2.

That is probably a different issue, but we'd need stacktraces to understand what is happening from the device that gets stuck.

On Linux you can send a SIGQUIT (but ideally after it has been stuck for some time), on Windows, I think you'd have to run with pprof enabled (https://docs.syncthing.net/users/syncthing.html STPROFILER) and then get the traces from `http://<address>/debug/pprof/goroutine?debug=2`


Again, best if you start a thread on the forums and keep the discussion there, until we know what needs to be fixed.

I will do it.

Thank you very much for a quick fix for the deadlock problem :slightly_smiling_face:.
